column4: hey i just installed wine from add/remove but how do i open it? there's no entry in the menus...
you dont really open it. search for wine again in package manager and download xwine you can run that otherwise you just wine whatever.exe
be sure to run 'winecfg' to configure it
so download xwine then run winecfg?
you dont need xwine but if you want a gui you do
okay thanks. i'll get it. makes things easier
where do i get xwine from tho? i'm not seeing it in either add/remove or synaptic
sorry not sure ill check after my update is finished
k just let me know when its done
odd its in debian. sorry i assumed itd be in ubuntu repos
try just clicking on the executables exe files should by default open with wine assuming the packager did a good job
sudo iptables -L to check but everything should be just accept unless youve installed firestarter or setup iptables yourself
okay gona check. using thunderbird with hotmail extension but the 2 servers fail to start on ports 110 and 25
sorry im tied up atm maybe someone here can offer better advise

its possible removing the new partition will fix it i suppose. thats one of the reasons i always mean to save my partitions table info. logical partitions are the way to go usually to avoid that its usually just things like windows that cant handle em
